Content: Just moved the exact amount of satoshies that  was paid to the fouinders address to a diffrent chain... provided the block times are averagfe 60s on both chains coin emission does not change.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Does ac_founders cause difficulties in any way?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not exactly... as long as teh multisig signers never change.... but we cannot know that... And its highly likely it will need to change. The PAYME chain, is how notaries get paid LABS, so they are motivated to keep it working at all times... We thaught maybe to make ti notary minable only also... but I dont think this is really needed as it ahs no block reward, I cant see why anyonje else would bother to mine it.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Could `-ac_founders` be used to have the chain create it's own 'dev fund' (used for exchange listings, website, marketing etc...) rather than rely on individuals' donations (KMD NNs) and be self-supporting?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: (notarizations being separate for the time being)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The notary nodes use ac_founders on the PAYME chain... as long as LABS has value then they can sell that to buy KMD...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: sorry

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmmm not sure exactly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We arleady take a ~22% of the block reward for notary nodes... not sure we should take too much.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I would hope that people who end up with quite a bit of LABS would do things like that out of their own pockets.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It's kind of in their best interests

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And if notaries decide between them some of the notary funds need to be uised for something, they can simply take that from the muiltisig address

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Yeah,  I was thinking it might be nice to have the chain being as self-suficient as possible.  Donations would be needed at the start and appreciated in the future of course.  I'm not sure how to to create that, but maybe -ac_founders would be part of that...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We can make ac_founders have some % to "dev fund"... As it is thats kind if what it is.... just an address owned by 15 people, what they decide to do with it is really up to them... It supposed to pay for notarisation costs, but it does not ahve to... If labs gets quite a bit of value, then there would be more there than they need to operate.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Depends if they deiced to keep the profits, between them or spend it to increase coin price.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It takes majority of signers... Or at least 50% , dont think the exact number was decided on yet.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: (atm, I have smk762's suggestion of 66% as the signers required as the only alternative suggestion to 50% - that's for bounties)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We dont want it to come down to like say a small majority of the signers hold the others to randsom and refuse to sign unless they get more money... its a diffiuclt thing to solve...

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Is it getting to complicated to keep dev fund on main chain, separate from bounties and notarizations, so chain can provide that for itself?  Notary pay and bounties on PAYME. Maybe eventually have Labs bounty funds (as opposed to non-Labs, private projects) supported by mainchain -ac_founders or something?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: bounty fund would be a new chain again... The mechanisim fo ther bounty chain still needs to be made.. I was going to make that as the first chain we make on mainnet.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We can take an addition founders reward from the main chain... IF we like... but who does it go to? If its a multisig address and someone wants to leave then the chain is broken, and requires complicated hard forks and exceptions in the code base to allow this.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Yean, sounds better to keep it as a separate module.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: By using seperate chains, we simply withdraw the staking weight off the chain when its not longer needed to be used and it stops... Create new chain. ONce the staking weight has been removed (or tis added to notarisation blacklist in code) then a new cahin with a new multiu sig address can be started.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its a little comploicated but not as bad as having to hard fork the main chain all the time... The idea of the main chain is to that it can be on exchanges etc... they are not going to handle multiple hard forks.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Do you think a dev fund would be controversial?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Im not sure what we need it for

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Was thinking mainly to, over time, reduce the reliance on needing a KMD NN.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If its something we need its not really an issue to add it... But I dont really think its required... All holders stake ... so they get "free money" anyway ... Its in their best intrests to do things to promote the coin etc... As long as notaries are making enough money to cover costs then everything is fine. Notaries can just sell some LABS to fund KMD needed... but having a KMD notary node just makes it easier.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Will a single multi-sig be used for everything? (NN payment, bounty approval, etc)?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: (I'm adding all of this to the info Alright requested)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Thanks. I think just one multi sig wil be needed.,.. maybe bounty would be less MofN required, dependig o0n what % of supply is allocated to bounties...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 1-5% is what has been discussed... But does not nessarily get used... If claims are not made then the coins are not moved. I hope to be able to have some kind of reverse nLockTime.... so that the minned bounty funds expire after some amount of time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: just to avoid the situation where there could be no bounties for ages and the signers deciding to withdraw the balance for themselvs.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: One thing I'm not clear on, is the 1-5% of supply for bounties offered by Labs for Labs projects(ie create a Labs visualization)?  While Project X would provide Labs with bounty funds for setting up an incentivized test and have notaries paying bounties?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The bounty funds are extra coins created that are not mined in the actaul block reward...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: they sit in a multisig address, until someone makes a claim

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if the signers of the multisig agree the claim is valid then it is paid.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If no claims are made those coins never enter supply.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The exact mecahnisim of this is still to be created... Hopefully there is a nice simple solution.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: And these claims could be made on any project?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes thats what the bounty mechnisim always was... Alright came up with it... I'm just trying to explain how I understand it to work.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Cool, just trying to get a better understanding.  Then I can write it better hopefully 😃

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no worries... I was always a bit confused by it tbh.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think by having it be some extra chain with an exact block reward as  % of the total supply that expires, it prevents people poking holes in it saying we can create as many coins as we like.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Yeah, the extra chain, modular, system sounds very good.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
I'm having a hard time getting a clear picture of the very basics of the bounties system though.
I could understand if Labs creates bounty funds for itself to uses for its own  project bounties.  With an outside project paying coins to Labs to set up and run a bounty program for them.
